==Events==
* [[222]] &ndash; Emperor [[Elagabalus]] is [[assassination|assassinated]], along with his mother, [[Julia Soaemias]], by the [[Praetorian Guard]] during a [[rebellion|revolt]]. Their [[mutilation|mutilated]] bodies are dragged through the streets of [[Ancient Rome|Rome]] before being thrown into the [[Tiber River|Tiber]].
*[[1387]] &ndash; [[Battle of Castagnaro]]: English [[condottiero]] [[John Hawkwood|Sir John Hawkwood]] leads [[Padua|Padova]] to victory in a factional clash with [[Verona]].
*[[1641]] &ndash; [[Guaraní people|Guaraní]] forces living in the [[Jesuit Reductions]] defeat [[bandeirantes]] loyal to the [[Portuguese Empire]] at the [[Battle of Mbororé]] in present-day [[Panambí|Panambí, Argentina]].
*[[1649]] &ndash; The [[Frondeurs]] and the [[France|French]] sign the [[Peace of Rueil]].
*[[1702]] &ndash; ''[[The Daily Courant]]'', [[England]]'s first national daily newspaper is published for the first time.
*[[1708]] &ndash; [[Anne, Queen of Great Britain|Queen Anne]] withholds [[Royal Assent]] from the [[Scottish Militia Bill 1708|Scottish Militia Bill]], the last time a [[Kingdom of Great Britain|British]] monarch vetoes legislation.
*[[1784]] &ndash; The signing of the [[Treaty of Mangalore]] brings the [[Second Anglo-Mysore War]] to an end.
*[[1811]] &ndash; During [[André Masséna]]'s retreat from the [[Lines of Torres Vedras]], a division led by [[Marshal of France|French Marshal]] [[Michel Ney]] [[Battle of Pombal|fights off]] a combined Anglo-Portuguese force to give Masséna time to escape.
*[[1824]] &ndash; The [[United States Department of War]] creates the [[Bureau of Indian Affairs]].
*[[1845]] &ndash; [[The Flagstaff War]]: Unhappy with translational differences regarding the [[Treaty of Waitangi]], chiefs [[Hone Heke]], [[Kawiti]] and [[Māori people|Māori]] tribe members chop down the British flagpole for a fourth time and drive settlers out of [[Kororareka]], [[New Zealand]].
*[[1848]] &ndash; [[Louis-Hippolyte Lafontaine]] and [[Robert Baldwin]] become the first Prime Ministers of the [[Province of Canada]] to be democratically elected under a system of [[responsible government]].
*[[1851]] &ndash; The first performance of ''[[Rigoletto]]'' by [[Giuseppe Verdi]] takes place in [[Venice]].
*[[1861]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: The [[Confederate States Constitution|Constitution of the Confederate States of America]] is adopted.
*[[1864]] &ndash; The [[Great Sheffield Flood]] kills 238 people in [[Sheffield]], England.
*[[1867]] &ndash; The first performance of ''[[Don Carlos]]'' by [[Giuseppe Verdi]] takes place in [[Paris]].
*[[1872]] &ndash; Construction of the [[Seven Sisters, Wales|Seven Sisters]] Colliery, [[South Wales]], begins; located on one of the richest coal sources in Britain.
*[[1879]] &ndash; [[Shō Tai]] formally abdicated his position of King of Ryūkyū, under orders from [[Tokyo]], ending the [[Ryukyu Kingdom]]
*[[1888]] &ndash; The [[Great Blizzard of 1888]] begins along the eastern seaboard of the United States, shutting down commerce and killing more than 400.
*[[1916]] &ndash; [[USS Nevada (BB-36)]] is commissioned. The first US Navy "[[super-dreadnought]]".
*[[1917]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: [[Baghdad]] [[Fall of Baghdad (1917)|falls]] to [[Anglo-Indian]] forces commanded by [[General]] [[Frederick Stanley Maude|Stanley Maude]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; The first case of [[1918 flu pandemic|Spanish flu]] occurs, the start of a devastating worldwide pandemic.
*[[1927]] &ndash; In [[New York City]], [[Samuel Roxy Rothafel]] opens the [[Roxy Theatre (New York City)|Roxy Theatre]].
*[[1931]] &ndash; ''[[Ready for Labour and Defence of the USSR]]'', abbreviated as ''GTO'', is introduced in the [[Soviet Union]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[President of the United States|President]] [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] signs the [[Lend-Lease]] Act into law, allowing American-built war supplies to be shipped to the [[Allies of World War II|Allies]] on loan.
*[[1942]] &ndash; World War II: [[General]] [[Douglas MacArthur]] leaves [[Corregidor]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II:  The [[Imperial Japanese Navy]] attempts a large-scale [[kamikaze]] attack on the [[United States Pacific Fleet|U.S. Pacific Fleet]] anchored at [[Ulithi]] atoll in [[Operation Tan No. 2]].
*  1945  &ndash; World War II: The [[Empire of Vietnam]], a short-lived [[puppet state]], is established with [[Bảo Đại]] as its ruler.
*[[1946]] &ndash; [[Rudolf Höss]], the first commandant of [[Auschwitz concentration camp]], is captured by British troops.
*[[1975]] &ndash; [[Vietnam War]]: [[North Vietnam]]ese and [[Viet Cong]] guerrilla forces [[Battle of Ban Me Thuot|establish control]] over [[Buôn Ma Thuột|Ban Me Thuot]] commune from the [[South Vietnam]]ese [[ARVN|army]].
*[[1977]] &ndash; The [[1977 Hanafi Muslim Siege]]: more than 130 hostages held in [[Washington, D.C.]], by [[Hanafi]] Muslims are set free after ambassadors from three [[Islam]]ic nations join negotiations.
*[[1978]] &ndash; [[Coastal Road massacre]]: At least 37 are killed and more than 70 are wounded when [[Al Fatah]] hijack an [[Israel]]i bus, prompting Israel's [[Operation Litani]].
*[[1983]] &ndash; [[Pakistan]] [[Project-706|successfully conducts]] a [[Cold fission|cold test]] of a [[nuclear weapon]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; [[Lithuania]] [[Act of the Re-Establishment of the State of Lithuania|declares itself independent]] from the Soviet Union.
*  1990   &ndash; [[Patricio Aylwin]] is sworn in as the first democratically elected [[President of Chile]] since 1970.
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[Janet Reno]] is confirmed by the [[United States Senate]] and sworn in the next day, becoming the first female [[Attorney General of the United States]].
*[[1999]] &ndash; [[Infosys]] becomes the first [[India]]n company listed on the [[NASDAQ]] stock exchange.
*[[2004]] &ndash; [[2004 Madrid train bombings|Madrid train bombings]]: Simultaneous explosions on rush hour trains in [[Madrid]], [[Spain]], kill 191 people.
*[[2006]] &ndash; [[Michelle Bachelet]] is inaugurated as first female president of Chile.
*[[2007]] &ndash; [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]] claims [[Russia]]n helicopters [[2007 Georgia helicopter attack|attack]]ed the [[Kodori Valley]] in [[Abkhazia]], an accusation that Russia categorically denies later.
*[[2009]] &ndash; [[Winnenden school shooting]]: 16 are killed and 11 are injured before recent-graduate Tim Kretschmer shoots and kills himself, leading to tightened weapons restrictions in [[Germany]].
*[[2010]] &ndash; Economist and businessman [[Sebastián Piñera]] is sworn in as [[President of Chile]], while [[2010 Pichilemu earthquake|three earthquakes]], the strongest measuring magnitude 6.9 and all centered next to [[Pichilemu]], capital of [[Cardenal Caro Province]], hit central Chile during the ceremony.
*[[2011]] &ndash; An [[2011 Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami|earthquake]] measuring 9.0 in magnitude strikes {{convert|130|km|mi|abbr=on}} east of [[Sendai]], Japan, triggering a [[2011 Japanese tsunami|tsunami]] killing thousands of people. This event also triggered the [[Fukushima Daiichi nuclear disaster|second largest nuclear accident]] in history, and one of only two events to be classified as a Level 7 on the [[International Nuclear Event Scale]].
*[[2012]] &ndash; A US soldier [[Kandahar massacre|kills 16 civilians]] in the [[Panjwayi District]] of [[Afghanistan]] near [[Kandahar]].
*[[2014]] &ndash; The [[Republic of Crimea]] declares its [[Declaration of Independence of Crimea|independence]].
